lexUnit.name: launch (into).v

document.description: Examples of the lemma launch from the MASC project for FN annotation
document.name: launch

lexUnit.definition: FN: begin an activity energetically and enthusiastically

sentence.text: The door opened and Robyn fixed her smile , prepared to launch into her quickly rehearsed explanation .
She cleared her throat nervously and was just about to launch into a business like explanation when he said suddenly , ` So what 's with the altered image ? "
If trusts , as is often said , depended on the testator 's intention and little else , then to launch into a discussion of the wordings they employed may well seem perverse .
Frank sat down again and launched into a tale of how he had outwitted the guards at every turn and been the mainstay of the prisoners .
It was really difficult to keep a straight face , but then Mr Taylor ` introduced " us and I just forgot about my shyness and launched into my speech .
Charity was included in it too and Mona launched into a short sermon on her favourite subject , patriotism .
` Good , " he said and launched into a description of the gift of the Glory .
It was a way of gaining Veronica 's confidence , Loretta thought , launching into a description of the work she 'd done so far .
As Jane went to phone the baby-sitter for the second time , Derek launched into another anecdote .
He waited for no introduction but launched into his current theme : ` It 's amazing !

So , as the architects comfortably settled back into their chairs cradling their after-dinner brandies in preparation for some regal platitudes , the Prince launched into a stinging attack that left them reeling .
After the high energy opening of ` The Locomotion " Kylie launched herself into a raunchy version of her second bit hit ` Got To Be Certain " .
Then Jeremiah launched into a prayer of complaint about what was happening to him .
Whereupon , the 29 year-old Mrs. Gerring launched into her theory that he had his club open at the address at the same time as his body was facing well left of the target .
There seemed little point in launching into the saga of her engagement , and it also seemed like an ideal opportunity to tell Piers obliquely that she was n't emotionally involved with him .
He launched into details of the sporting activities in which he thought she took part .
We launch into a little Talmudic logic-chopping of our own on the question of free will and responsibility when a dybbuk is in residence .
No such extravagance here , as under the watchful eye of Asquith , he launched into some of his best known songs .
I express an interest and Gordon launches into a detailed and exhausting explanation of its functions and the quality of the investment he 's made .
Rainbow ignores this , launches instead into a soliloquy about workday stress , and the loneliness of the London taxi-driver .
He launched into a detailed explanation , punctuated with stolen bites at the food on his plate , and Lissa followed his words with careful absorption , nodding occasionally .

Following a suitable period of mourning for his exploded mate ( five seconds ) , Austin greets his restored bachelorhood with a frenzy of exhibitionism -- romping nude through the lobby of his posh hotel , pointing out his privates to assorted female passers-by , and launching into a lengthy water ballet in the company of Esther Williams -style chorines .
U.S. soccer pundits immediately launched into the all-American pastime of fixing blame and complaining about bad luck .
